subject: Climate & Environment
title: Mangrove Forests
description: A quick, practical guide to Mangrove Forests.

hook.text: Mangroves grow where land meets sea â€” roots tangled in saltwater, defying the tides.

buildup.text: They protect coastlines from storms, filter water, and serve as nurseries for fish.

discovery.text: Mangroves store up to 4 times more carbon per hectare than tropical rainforests.

twist.text: Half the world's mangroves have been destroyed for shrimp farms and coastal development.

climax.text: Losing mangroves exposes coasts to flooding and releases massive stores of buried carbon.

punchline.text: The trees standing in the ocean are worth more than the land behind them.

quiz.question: How do mangroves compare to rainforests in carbon storage per hectare?
